result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Gayan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to prison on 5-6-21; unpaid supervision fees of $1,440 per DOC
for the May 6, 2021 Sentencing after Revocation hearing filed by Marjorie Kurtz

2:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Crystal N Long appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Jason C. Gayan appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail, Attorney Mark David Lawton appeared by video for Jason C. Gayan. Joint sentencing recommendation, statements by counsel. Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 yrs prison - 2 yrs initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision consecutive to any other sentence currently serving.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 149 days sentence credit.  Civil judgment to be entered for any unpaid financial obligations.
appointing Atty Lawton
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 6, 2021 at 02:00 pm.

Order revoking Huber privileges and loss of all good time due to jail violations.
Filed by ADA Clifford Burdon
filed by Atty Todd Bennett

Defendant Jason C. Gayan in court with attorney Todd W. Bennett.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed by ADA Burdon.  Amended information orally amended to remove 2nd and sub. on Ct. 1.  State will file a 2nd amended complaint.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 7 years.  Conditions of probation include AODA and comply, submit DNA sample, $2733.00 fines and costs.  On Ct. 3 Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 months in jail, with Huber work release, and childcare.  $278.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start 10/23/15  7:00 pm.  Bond on hand is to be applied towards costs of $278.00.  The amount due to probation will not be paid out of bond, this is to be paid within 2 years by defendant.  2 days jail credit.  Defendant is to report to probation by 4pm Monday.
Poster Carol P. requests bond be returned to her and not used for costs/fines.

scheduling order
Jury trial on August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Continued preliminary from earlier this month. Defendant Jason C. Gayan in court with attorney Todd W. Bennett.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No testimony taken. Atty. Todd Bennett stated there is no probable cause. ADA Yaskal moved for bindover.  Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Jason C. Gayan in court with attorney Todd W. Bennett.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Atty Bennett offered evidence of a tape/cd.  State did not object.  Recording was received by court, returned to Atty Bennett to get transcripted.  Court adjorned.  Will resume 1/29/15 for 9:00 preliminary hearing. Bond remains.
Filed by Atty Todd Bennett

Defendant Jason C. Gayan in court with attorney Mark H. Bennett appearing for Atty Todd Bennett.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Atty Bennett requested a preliminary hearing.  Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal
